description:
In a world populated by anthropomorphic animals, herbivores and carnivores coexist with each other. For the adolescents of Cherryton Academy, school life is filled with hope, romance, distrust, and uneasiness.

The main character is Legoshi the wolf, a member of the drama club. Despite his menacing appearance, he has a very gentle heart. Throughout most of his life, he has always been an object of fear and hatred by other animals, and he’s been quite accustomed to that lifestyle. But soon, he finds himself becoming more involved with his fellow classmates who have their own share of insecurities and finds his life in school changing slowly.

(Source: moetron)

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Cannibalism
tags.description: Prominently features the act of consuming another member of the same species as food.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Boarding School
tags.description: Features characters attending a boarding school.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Animal Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed animal or animal-like characters.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Politics
tags.description: Centers around politics, politicians, or government activities.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Rape
tags.description: Features non-consensual sexual penetration.

tags.name: Vore
tags.description: Features a character being swallowed or swallowing another creature whole.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

node.description:
[Website](https://tentenparuparu.tumblr.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/itaparu99)

She was born in Tokyo, Japan. Paru studied filmography in university, but was more interested in using pen and paper.

She is the daughter of the famous mangaka [Keisuke Itagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/99488/). 
 
She announced her marriage to a man from outside the industry on September 24th, 2023.

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

The founder and CEO of Studio ORANGE. He began as freelance CG creator in the game industry, before switching to anime with 'Zoids: Chaotic Century‘ in 1999. Founded Studio ORANGE in 2004 after working on Shoji Kawamori's 'Aquarion'. He has worked as a 3D/CGI Director and/or Producer for shows from Madhouse, Xebec, Doga Kobo, Kinema Citrus, and Passione.

**Height:** 147 cm

[Profile (Toho Entertainment)](https://www.toho-ent.co.jp/actor/1127) | [Website](https://www.yu-ri-ka.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/yurika_official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_YURiKA29_) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yurika_(musician)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/YURiKA_(歌手))

Yurika Kobayashi, mononymously known by the stage name YURiKA, is a Japanese musician from Hasuda, Saitama who is signed to Toho Animation Records.

From an early age, she had dreamed of becoming a musician. She started playing the piano at the age of 3, and she also listened to the music of [Morning Musume](https://anilist.co/staff/150336/) and its subgroup Minimoni. While in elementary school, she heard the song "Genesis of Aquarion" by [Akino](https://anilist.co/staff/109335/) in a commercial, which led her to become interested in anime music and a desire to perform songs for anime. Her desire to become an anime musician was also influenced by the popularity of the series [Haruhi Suzumiya](https://anilist.co/anime/849/) and [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680/KON/) at the time.

In high school, she tried out for the Animax Anison Grand Prix and other anime-related singing competitions. In 2014, she placed 6th in a televised competition sponsored by Nippon TV and first in an anime music singing competition sponsored by NHK. In 2016, she won an audition sponsored by the media company Toho and signed a contract with label Toho Animation Records.

She made her professional debut in 2017 with the release of her first single "Shiny Ray" on February 22, 2017; the title track is used as the first opening theme to the anime television series [Little Witch Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21858/).

**Genres:** Hip-hop, Funk, Jazz

__[Website](https://alienlibertyinternational.com/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ALI_MUSIC_DANCE)__ | __[Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnYvfe8YHnRRly5SCA8mP5A)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/2Qqrew4ZcEwf9NY7UqWGfU)__

__Introduction:__
ALI, otherwise known as Alien Liberty International, is a multinational hip-hop/funk band led by vocalist [Reo Imamura](https://anilist.co/staff/158752/Reo-Imamura), otherwise known as Leo. The band has its roots all over earth, from Japan to Europe, the United States to Asia, Africa and other countries.

Their first single *"Wild Side"* was chosen as the opening theme to the anime [*BEASTARS*](https://anilist.co/anime/107660). A year later, their second single *"Lost in Paradise"* featuring rapper [AKLO](https://anilist.co/staff/191499/) was chosen as the ending theme to the anime [*Jujutsu Kaisen*](https://anilist.co/anime/113415).

The band announced an indefinite hiatus on May 14, 2021 following the arrest and indictment of member Kahadio. They also announced his contract termination from the band the same day.  As a result, the band was dropped from performing the opening theme *"Teenage City Riot"* for the anime [*Subarashiki Kono Sekai The Animation*](https://anilist.co/anime/120376) before it began airing. Half a year later on Nov 18, following their indefinite hiatus, the band announced they would resume activities.

__Members:__
- [Reo Imamura](https://anilist.co/staff/158752/Reo-Imamura) (今村怜央), better known as Leo – leader, vocalist
- [Luthfi Kusuma](https://anilist.co/staff/158776/Luthfi) (楠間ルッフィ), better known as Luthfi – bassist
- [Alexander Taiyou Fidel](https://anilist.co/staff/158775/Alex) (アレクサンダー・タイヨウ・フィデル), better known as Alex – percussionist
- [Aiichirou Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/192971) (田中愛一朗), better known as Cesar – guitarist

__Former Members:__
- [Jua](https://anilist.co/staff/158751/Jua) – rapper
- [Zeru](https://anilist.co/staff/158774/Zeru) – guitarist
- [Kadio Shirai](https://anilist.co/staff/158772/Kahadio) (白井カディオ), better known as Kahadio – drummer
- [Yuu Hagiwara](https://anilist.co/staff/158777/Yu) (萩原優), better known as Yuu/Yu – saxist
- [Jin Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/158773/Jin) (井上仁), better known as Jin – keyboardist/pianist
Kouki Oota is a Japanese CG director and artist, who also does photography.
